meanings.definition: A sudden, loud sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: The blasting of the horn startled the cat.
meanings.sent2: The blasting music from the concert could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The blasting thunder made the little girl jump.
meanings.sent4: The blasting of fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The blasting of the cannon echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: The act of using explosives to break up or remove something.
meanings.sent1: The blasting of rocks in the quarry was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The blasting of the old building made way for a new construction.
meanings.sent3: The blasting of the pinata scattered candies everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The blasting of the dam unleashed a torrent of water.
meanings.sent5: The blasting of the mountain revealed hidden caves.

meanings.sent1: The blasting wind nearly blew off my hat.
meanings.sent2: The blasting speed of the car left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent3: The blasting squirrel darted across the yard with an acorn.
meanings.sent4: The blasting train rushed past the platform.
meanings.sent5: The blasting rocket soared into the sky.
